page.title: 08KILMERSDON AND AREA
page.content: Those still active in Estate work and those whose lives were spent in its service, make up the bulk of the population, about 400. As in most villages there is a proportion of retired people. In order to keep the vitality of the village it is policy to let homes to families with young children, so there is a better age mix than in many such communities. People from all walks of life and from different parts of the country have settled here furing the past twenty years and the commuting population is growing. Although a close community, newcomers are readily accepted.
